intro: Boechera schistacea, commonly known as the rockcress or stony cress, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is characterized by its low-growing habit and small, clustered leaves that are often covered in a fine layer of white hair. The plant produces clusters of tiny, white or pale yellow flowers that bloom in early spring. Boechera schistacea is typically found in rocky or gravelly soils, often in alpine or arid environments. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, which includes other members such as mustard and cabbage.
